results.title: An Heir, a $25 Million Giveaway and 30,000 Unopened Letters
results.abstract: In 1970, Michael James Brody Jr. announced he would give away his fortune to anyone who asked. The letters he received are a time capsule of the setting of the Age of Aquarius.

multimedia.caption: “It’s very, very unusual to get everyday people’s stories into the archives in a way like this, with thousands of people writing and talking about their lives at one moment in time,” said Thai Jones, a curator at Columbia.
multimedia.copyright: Vincent Tullo for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: “It’s very, very unusual to get everyday people’s stories into the archives in a way like this, with thousands of people writing and talking about their lives at one moment in time,” said Thai Jones, a curator at Columbia.

results.title: ‘The Survivor’ Review: Clenched Fists
results.abstract: In this drama from Barry Levinson, Ben Foster plays a Jewish boxer who, during the Holocaust, was forced to fight his fellow Jews for the Nazis’ entertainment.

multimedia.caption: Ben Foster, right, with Vicky Krieps in “The Survivor.”
Ben Foster, right, with Vicky Krieps in “The Survivor.”
Ben Foster, right, with Vicky Krieps in “The Survivor.”

results.title: ‘The Mystery of Marilyn Monroe: The Unheard Tapes’ Review: Gossip Girl
results.abstract: This documentary teases a vague conspiracy surrounding Monroe’s death — but mostly rehashes well-circulated facts and rumors.
des_facet: The Mystery of Marilyn Monroe: The Unheard Tapes (Movie)

results.title: A Boxer at Auschwitz and the Pain He Carried
results.abstract: Ordered to win fights or be put to death, Harry Haft, the subject of a new film, was haunted by the fates of his opponents.

multimedia.caption: Ben Foster, center, as Harry Haft, with John Leguizamo, left, Paul Bates and Danny DeVito in “The Survivor.”

results.title: Criminal Charges Still Possible in ‘Rust’ Shooting, Sheriff Says
results.abstract: Newly released evidence shows the leads investigators pursued as they try to learn how a live round got into Alec Baldwin’s gun, which fired, killing the film’s cinematographer.
results.byline: By Julia Jacobs and Graham Bowley

multimedia.caption: The cinematographer Halyna Hutchins was shot dead Oct. 21 on the set of “Rust” when a revolver Alec Baldwin was practicing with turned out to contain a live round.
The cinematographer Halyna Hutchins was shot dead Oct. 21 on the set of “Rust” when a revolver Alec Baldwin was practicing with turned out to contain a live round.
The cinematographer Halyna Hutchins was shot dead Oct. 21 on the set of “Rust” when a revolver Alec Baldwin was practicing with turned out to contain a live round.

results.title: ‘The Bad Guys’ and the Crossroads Its Author Faced
results.abstract: Unable to support his family with his children’s books, Aaron Blabey was ready to give up. Then he came up with the concept that’s now a best seller and an animated movie.

multimedia.caption: Aaron Blabey in Los Angeles: “I’m the epitome of a late bloomer, I guess.”
multimedia.copyright: Alex Welsh for The New York Times

results.title: ‘The Northman’ Wasn’t Easy to Make. But That’s How Robert Eggers Likes It.
results.abstract: The director explains why he sought out such difficult conditions, why he won’t talk with an actor about a character’s back story and why the box office matters.

results.title: ‘Rust’ Investigators Release Crime Scene Photos, Await Key Evidence
results.abstract: The criminal investigation of Alec Baldwin’s fatal shooting of a cinematographer on a film set cannot be completed without key ballistics and other evidence, the Santa Fe County sheriff said.
results.byline: By Graham Bowley and Julia Jacobs

results.title: Library of Congress Acquires Neil Simon Papers
results.abstract: The collection of approximately 7,700 items, donated by Simon’s widow, includes dozens of unfinished shows, including a screenplay written for Bette Midler and Whoopi Goldberg.

results.title: For Panah Panahi, Being the Son of an Iranian Auteur Wasn’t Entirely Helpful
results.abstract: He was long paralyzed by the prospect of being compared with Jafar Panahi. But it was his sister who spurred the young director to make his acclaimed new film.

multimedia.caption: Panah Panahi has considered leaving Iran. But “since cinema is my passion and only way of expression, I cannot make films elsewhere.”

results.title: In ‘The Duke,’ Jim Broadbent Puts an Eccentric at the Center
results.abstract: The British actor has spent six decades seeking out carefully observed, often quirky characters. In his latest film, he’s also the lead.

multimedia.caption: “Since I wasn’t easily castable in any particular thing, I knew I had to cast my net very wide,” Jim Broadbent said of his career.

results.title: Jimmy Wang Yu, Seminal Figure in Kung Fu Films, Dies at 79
results.abstract: He changed the nature of Asian martial arts movies, which had been relying on sword fighting and fantasy, by bringing hand-to-hand combat to the fore.

multimedia.caption: The martial arts star Jimmy Wang Yu at the Cannes Film Festival in 2011. His success in the 1960s paved the way for stars like Bruce Lee and Jackie Chan.
The martial arts star Jimmy Wang Yu at the Cannes Film Festival in 2011. His success in the 1960s paved the way for stars like Bruce Lee and Jackie Chan.

results.title: ‘The Unbearable Weight of Massive Talent’ Review: Being Nicolas Cage
